newsitem.title: MONGOLIA: MONGOLIA JAN-JULY INDUSTRIAL OUTPUT SOARS 35.6 PCT.
newsitem.headline: MONGOLIA JAN-JULY INDUSTRIAL OUTPUT SOARS 35.6 PCT.

text.p: Mongolia's gross industrial output soared 35.6 percent year-on-year to 161 billion tugriks in January-July this year, up from 119 billion tugriks in the same period last year, official statistics showed on Tuesday.
The energy, mining, and food and beverage industries all showed major increases in output, the State Statistical Bulletin showed.

Coal output in the first seven months was valued at 14.1 billion tugriks, up from 7.18 billion in the year-ago period, and electricity and thermal energy generation increased to 41.2 billion tugriks, up from 20 billion.
Output in mining of metal ores rose to 40.9 billion tugriks, up from 32.7 billion a year ago, while production of food and beverages increased to 27 billion tugriks, up from 20.5 billion a year ago.
Sales rose to 198 billion tugriks, up from 157.8 billion in the same period last year.
